trans-unit.source: Test Devices

seg-source.mrk: Test Devices

trans-unit.source: Test devices are defined as all kinds of tools that a quality control employee requires in order to carry out a test (such as scales, photometer, hardness- or thickness tachymeter and so on).

seg-source.mrk: Test devices are defined as all kinds of tools that a quality control employee requires in order to carry out a test (such as scales, photometer, hardness- or thickness tachymeter and so on).

trans-unit.source: Test Device Card

seg-source.mrk: Test Device Card

trans-unit.source: On the Test Device Card, the master data of the test device that will be used to determine the actual values of the test properties is maintained.

seg-source.mrk: On the Test Device Card, the master data of the test device that will be used to determine the actual values of the test properties is maintained.

trans-unit.source: : Test Device Card, General FastTab

seg-source.mrk: : Test Device Card, General FastTab

seg-source.mrk: General FastTab

trans-unit.source: The fields on this FastTab are described in the following table.

seg-source.mrk: The fields on this FastTab are described in the following table.

trans-unit.source: Field

seg-source.mrk: Field

trans-unit.source: Description

seg-source.mrk: Description

trans-unit.source: No.

seg-source.mrk: No.

trans-unit.source: Unique identifier from the number series or manually entered if manual numbering is allowed.

seg-source.mrk: Unique identifier from the number series or manually entered if manual numbering is allowed.

trans-unit.source: Description

seg-source.mrk: Description

trans-unit.source: Description by which the test device is to be managed (scales, measure, etc.) within the system.

seg-source.mrk: Description by which the test device is to be managed (scales, measure, etc.) within the system.

trans-unit.source: Responsible

seg-source.mrk: Responsible

trans-unit.source: For every test device, a certain employee can be defined who is responsible for the proper use and maintenance of the device. Click the arrow to access the Users page.

seg-source.mrk: For every test device, a certain employee can be defined who is responsible for the proper use and maintenance of the device.
Click the arrow to access the Users page.

trans-unit.source: Status

seg-source.mrk: Status

trans-unit.source: Indicates if a test device is released for processing tests or if it is blocked. Newly created test devices always have the status Certified whereas the status can be changed manually. The Status and Blocking Reason fields are automatically updated when the “Block Test Devices” batch job is run.

seg-source.mrk: Indicates if a test device is released for processing tests or if it is blocked.
Newly created test devices always have the status Certified whereas the status can be changed manually.
The Status and Blocking Reason fields are automatically updated when the “Block Test Devices” batch job is run.

trans-unit.source: Blocking Reason

seg-source.mrk: Blocking Reason

trans-unit.source: Reason that the test device has been blocked.

seg-source.mrk: Reason that the test device has been blocked.

trans-unit.source: Department

seg-source.mrk: Department

trans-unit.source: Assigns the test device to a certain department, such as workshop, laboratory and so on.

seg-source.mrk: Assigns the test device to a certain department, such as workshop, laboratory and so on.

trans-unit.source: Substitute Test Device

seg-source.mrk: Substitute Test Device

trans-unit.source: Select to indicate that the test device should be substituted with a new test device soon, or can be used as a substitute for another test device. This field is used for informational purposes only.

seg-source.mrk: Select to indicate that the test device should be substituted with a new test device soon, or can be used as a substitute for another test device.
This field is used for informational purposes only.

trans-unit.source: Date of First Release

seg-source.mrk: Date of First Release

trans-unit.source: The first release date of a test device, used for determining the age of the device.

seg-source.mrk: The first release date of a test device, used for determining the age of the device.

trans-unit.source: Testing FastTab

seg-source.mrk: Testing FastTab

trans-unit.source: The fields on this FastTab display testing information.

seg-source.mrk: The fields on this FastTab display testing information.

trans-unit.source: : Test Device Card, Testing FastTab

seg-source.mrk: : Test Device Card, Testing FastTab

trans-unit.source: The fields on this FastTab are described in the following table.

seg-source.mrk: The fields on this FastTab are described in the following table.

trans-unit.source: Field

seg-source.mrk: Field

trans-unit.source: Description

seg-source.mrk: Description

trans-unit.source: Test Cycle

seg-source.mrk: Test Cycle

trans-unit.source: Frequency in which the test device should be tested.

seg-source.mrk: Frequency in which the test device should be tested.

trans-unit.source: Last Test Date / Next Date Test Required

seg-source.mrk: Last Test Date / Next Date Test Required

trans-unit.source: The formula from the Test Cycle field is used to calculate the date in the Next Date Test Required field, which is based on the date in the Last Test Date field.

seg-source.mrk: The formula from the Test Cycle field is used to calculate the date in the Next Date Test Required field, which is based on the date in the Last Test Date field.

trans-unit.source: If the date of the next test required has expired, the test device can be blocked using the “Block Test Devices” batch job and thus become subject of a test.

seg-source.mrk: If the date of the next test required has expired, the test device can be blocked using the “Block Test Devices” batch job and thus become subject of a test.

trans-unit.source: Default Test Plan No.

seg-source.mrk: Default Test Plan No.

trans-unit.source: Standard test plan according to which the test device should be tested.

seg-source.mrk: Standard test plan according to which the test device should be tested.

trans-unit.source: Note

seg-source.mrk: Note

trans-unit.source: This field must be populated to use the “Create Test Order” function on the “Block Test Devices” batch job (refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="#_Ref415833000" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Block Test Devices” on page 1</MadCap:xref>).

seg-source.mrk: This field must be populated to use the “Create Test Order” function on the “Block Test Devices” batch job (refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="#_Ref415833000" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Block Test Devices” on page 1</MadCap:xref>).

trans-unit.source: Test Order Exist

seg-source.mrk: Test Order Exist

trans-unit.source: Indicates if a test order exists for the test device. This field will be set to Yes if a test order has been created by running the “Block Test Devices” batch job.

seg-source.mrk: Indicates if a test order exists for the test device.
This field will be set to Yes if a test order has been created by running the “Block Test Devices” batch job.

trans-unit.source: Last Tester

seg-source.mrk: Last Tester

trans-unit.source: Opens the Users page; is automatically populated with the ID of the user who finishes or cancels a test order.

trans-unit.source: Create Test Order

seg-source.mrk: Create Test Order

trans-unit.source: Creates an instant test order for the test device (refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="#_Ref421543538" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Instant Testing” on page 1</MadCap:xref>).

seg-source.mrk: Creates an instant test order for the test device (refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="#_Ref421543538" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Instant Testing” on page 1</MadCap:xref>).

trans-unit.source: Block Test Device

seg-source.mrk: Block Test Device

trans-unit.source: Opens the “Block Test Devices” batch job (refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="#_Ref415833000" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Block Test Devices” on page 1</MadCap:xref>).

seg-source.mrk: Opens the “Block Test Devices” batch job (refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="#_Ref415833000" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Block Test Devices” on page 1</MadCap:xref>).

trans-unit.source: Internal Comments / External Comments

seg-source.mrk: Internal Comments / External Comments

trans-unit.source: Comments can be used to add notes and remarks about a test device.

seg-source.mrk: Comments can be used to add notes and remarks about a test device.

trans-unit.source: Internal comments are printed on documents that will not leave the company such as test plans.

seg-source.mrk: Internal comments are printed on documents that will not leave the company such as test plans.

trans-unit.source: External comments will appear on documents that can be sent to the customer or vendor.

seg-source.mrk: External comments will appear on documents that can be sent to the customer or vendor.

seg-source.mrk: Test Device List

trans-unit.source: Generates the Test Device List report for preview or printing.

seg-source.mrk: Generates the Test Device List report for preview or printing.

trans-unit.source: Instant Testing

seg-source.mrk: Instant Testing

trans-unit.source: A test order can be created for the instant testing of a test device by clicking Create Test Order on the ribbon of the Test Device Card or Test Device list. The following events occur when the “Create Test Order” function is run:

seg-source.mrk: A test order can be created for the instant testing of a test device by clicking Create Test Order on the ribbon of the Test Device Card or Test Device list.
The following events occur when the “Create Test Order” function is run:

trans-unit.source: The Test Device Card page is updated with the Status to Blocked and the Blocking Reason to Instant Testing.

seg-source.mrk: The Test Device Card page is updated with the Status to Blocked and the Blocking Reason to Instant Testing.

trans-unit.source: : Test Device fields after creation of Instant Test

seg-source.mrk: : Test Device fields after creation of Instant Test

trans-unit.source: The Test Order/Value Recording Card page opens with the Status set to Value Recording for instant testing.

seg-source.mrk: The Test Order/Value Recording Card page opens with the Status set to Value Recording for instant testing.

trans-unit.source: : Instant Test Order created from Test Device

seg-source.mrk: : Instant Test Order created from Test Device

trans-unit.source: Note

seg-source.mrk: Note

trans-unit.source: A Default Test Plan must be specified on the Test Device Card to create an instant test order.

seg-source.mrk: A Default Test Plan must be specified on the Test Device Card to create an instant test order.

trans-unit.source: The Status on the Test Device is reset to Certified when the test is finished with an Inspection Result of Items are OK and the Blocking Reason field is cleared. Additionally, the Last Tester field is populated with the ID of the user who finished the test order and the Last Test Date field is updated accordingly.

seg-source.mrk: The Status on the Test Device is reset to Certified when the test is finished with an Inspection Result of Items are OK and the Blocking Reason field is cleared.
Additionally, the Last Tester field is populated with the ID of the user who finished the test order and the Last Test Date field is updated accordingly.

trans-unit.source: : Test Device after Instant Test Order is finished with Items are OK

seg-source.mrk: : Test Device after Instant Test Order is finished with Items are OK

trans-unit.source: Block Test Devices

seg-source.mrk: Block Test Devices

trans-unit.source: Test devices are subject to the test cycles specified on the Test Device Card (refer to topic "Testing FastTab" on page 1). The “Block Test Devices” batch job – accessed from the cc|quality management menu by clicking Tasks > Block Test Devices or on the ribbon of the Test Device Card page – blocks test devices that are out of use or create test orders for test devices that need to be calibrated.

seg-source.mrk: Test devices are subject to the test cycles specified on the Test Device Card (refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="#_Ref314489822" class="RelLinkPageNumber" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">"Testing FastTab" on page 1</MadCap:xref>).

The “Block Test Devices” batch job – accessed from the cc|quality management menu by clicking Tasks > Block Test Devices or on the ribbon of the Test Device Card page – blocks test devices that are out of use or create test orders for test devices that need to be calibrated.

trans-unit.source: : Block Test Devices batch job

seg-source.mrk: : Block Test Devices batch job

trans-unit.source: On the Options FastTab, it is possible to enter a reason for blocking the test device, which is then transferred to the Blocking Reason field on the corresponding Test Device Card. Select the Create Test Order check box to automatically create a test order for all newly blocked test devices.

seg-source.mrk: On the Options FastTab, it is possible to enter a reason for blocking the test device, which is then transferred to the Blocking Reason field on the corresponding Test Device Card.
Select the Create Test Order check box to automatically create a test order for all newly blocked test devices.

trans-unit.source: Note

seg-source.mrk: Note

trans-unit.source: A Default Test Plan must be specified on the Test Device Card to create a test order.

seg-source.mrk: A Default Test Plan must be specified on the Test Device Card to create a test order.

trans-unit.source: In the Test Device FastTab, a date interval can be specified. If the date in the Next Date Test Required field on the Test Device Card is within this date interval, a test order will be created for the test device if the Create Test Order check box is selected on the Options FastTab.

seg-source.mrk: In the Test Device FastTab, a date interval can be specified.

If the date in the Next Date Test Required field on the Test Device Card is within this date interval, a test order will be created for the test device if the Create Test Order check box is selected on the Options FastTab.

trans-unit.source: Caution

seg-source.mrk: Caution

trans-unit.source: If a date is not entered in the Next Date Test Required field, all test devices are blocked after running this batch job.

seg-source.mrk: If a date is not entered in the Next Date Test Required field, all test devices are blocked after running this batch job.

trans-unit.source: The “Block Test Devices” function is filtered on the selected Test Device when run from the Test Device Card; therefore, only the selected test device(s) will be blocked.

seg-source.mrk: The “Block Test Devices” function is filtered on the selected Test Device when run from the Test Device Card; therefore, only the selected test device(s) will be blocked.
